newsitem.title: MEXICO: Anchor Glass sale seen positive for Mexico's Vitro.
newsitem.headline: Anchor Glass sale seen positive for Mexico's Vitro.

text.p: The sale of Mexican glassmaker Vitro S.A.'s troubled Anchor Glass Corp unit is a turning point in the company's efforts to restructure, analysts said on Friday.

Vitro said on Friday it had reached a non-binding agreement with Ball-Foster Container Co to sell Anchor for an estimated $365 million. In addition, Ball-Foster would assume Anchor's main liabilities, analysts said.

"This is very positive news. Anchor Glass doesn't really contribute to Vitro's earnings, and it costs about $60 million a year in interest payments," said Sandra Morfin, an analyst at Caspian Securities in Mexico City.
In August, Vitro said it wanted to sell Anchor because of slowing demand for glass containers in the U.S. and the company's operating losses and liquidity needs.
